result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark E Green

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Mark E Green
Current: 3551 Haga Drive, Plover, WI 54467 United States  (Effective: 07-19-2022)
Prior: 3308 Dixon St, Stevens Point, WI 54481
Pre-trial conference on July 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued. 

State will file information mirroring charge in the complaint.

Not guilty plea is entered.
BY THE COURT:
Bond is continued.

8:58 AM Prosecuting attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark E Green in court. 

Court calls case.
Atty Mutchler states appearances.
Matter is set for an initial appearance today.
File notes that Defendant is represented by Atty Soule but she is not here.

Court will call the case once Atty Soule is present.

9:14 AM Case is recalled.
Atty Soule is now present.
Address of Defendant is verified.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Atty Soule requests to enter a not guilty plea and waive time limits.
Information has not been filed.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial Appearance set for May 16, 2022 @ 9:00 a.m. in Br 1
Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.

1:21 PM Defendant Mark Exodus Green appeared by video, in custody.  Atty Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant. Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 

ADA Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of vehicle operator flee/elude officer - felony.
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant is public defender eligible.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $750 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule objects to the cash bond and states her reasons on the record.

Court will adopt the cash bond as recommended by the State with conditions as stated on the record.
Hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
